summary: Arya x Gendry Week; Day 2: caught Red-Handed "So why don’t you tell me about your friend?" Arya stared at her sister, not really...
body:
Arya x Gendry Week; Day 2: caught Red-Handed

“So why don’t you tell me about your friend?”
Arya stared at her sister, not really knowing what to answer to the question that lingered in the air. Since she started hanging out with Gendry after he arrived in Winterfell, her family decided that there was something other than friendship going on between the two of them but there was nothing happening. Yes, sometimes she liked to admire his ocean blue eyes or the outlines of his muscles when he worked but nothing strange was going on. Absolutely nothing.
“He is my friend. That’s all there is to say. What do you want me to tell you?”
“I don’t want you to tell me anything”, Sansa said, her eyes showing the thoughts that she didn’t dare to say out loud. “You just don’t look like friends, that’s all.”
“Yea, but that is what we are. Friends. I don’t understand why everyone in Winterfell keeps assuming that Gendry is my secret lover. We just like to spar with each other and talk about swords. It is not that hard to grasp.”
Her sister looked at her as if she was stupid. Sansa was the one person at home that truly believed that Gendry and Arya had something going on between the two of them, but she just grinned at her sister’s futile attempts to hide her true feelings regarding her “friend”.
“Sure Arya. When you two start doing a different kind of "sparring”, just tell me I was right, as usual.“
With this remark, Sansa left the room leaving Arya gaping at the wall,  shocked at her sister’s intelligent, but also improper use of words.

Arya watched him hitting the metal at the forge, again and again, bending the material at his will.  He’s strong, she thought, as she continued to watch him do his work.
"How did the meeting with your sister go?”, Gendry asked, wiping the sweat of his forehead and making Arya “wake up” from her inner world.
“It went well. Sansa talked about the usual stuff”, Arya blurted, desperately wanting to change the course that the conversation was headed. “ Why do you ask?”
“You seem a little bit distracted. It looks like the conversation got you thinking about something”, he uttered, sitting beside her on the table filled with swords and shields to fix.
“Sansa likes to put people confused about their feelings regarding anyone or anything. Who is she to assume who I want and don’t want to fuck?”, Arya snarled, noticing the words that came out of her mouth a bit too late.
Gendry’s eyes darted to Arya, stunned by what he had just heard. He also knew about the rumors that lived in the people’s mouths, rumors about his relationship with Arya.
“Gendry, I… I didn’t mean to say that”, she stuttered, something that she only did when she was feeling mortified
Without a warning, his mouth was pressed to hers, leaving her astonished at the outcome of their conversation. Soon enough, her astonishment left the room only to be replaced with a sense of lust so strong that almost turned her body into a quivering mess. Without second thoughts, she straddled him, nearly sending a bunch of broken shields to the forge’s floor.
“Gendry, I need you to fix…”
As Jon’s voice and consequently his silence filled the room, Arya and Gendry were left appalled at the recent turn of events.
With a horrified look on his face, Jon closed the forge’s door and left, muttering to himself.
“That will teach him to knock on doors before entering”, Arya snickered.
Gendry had a disturbed look on his face, looking like the world had ended recently.
“Come on that was funny”, said Arya, laughing at her brother’s misfortune. “You are not going to die, so you can laugh with me, you know?”
With this comment, both of them started laughing so hard that Arya felled from Gendry’s lap to the forge’s floor.

“So are you going to tell me I was right or…?”
“Fuck off Sansa”

summary: ARYA CAN SEE AGAIN

🐺 Arya Stark appreciation 17/-

  Each night before sleep, she murmured her prayer into her pillow. “Ser Gregor,” it went....
caption:
🐺 Arya Stark appreciation 17/-

Each night before sleep, she murmured her prayer into her pillow. “Ser Gregor,” it went. “Dunsen, Raff the Sweetling, Ser Ilyn, Ser Meryn, Queen Cersei.” She would have whispered the names of the Freys of the Crossing too, if she had known them. One day I’ll know, she told herself, and then I’ll kill them all.

summary: Eye Contact Gendry was early for supper that day, he stood near one of the tall walls in the Winterfell hall waiting for the...
body:
Eye Contact

Gendry was early for supper that day, he stood near one of the tall walls in the Winterfell hall waiting for the rest to arrive. His fingers kept tugging his shirt down and the little sounds his boots made kept betraying he was fidgeting, despite having lunched and dinned with the Royals for weeks. He approached the table when Davos, Jon and Lady Sansa walked through the doors, and silently sat down beside the elder of the group when he took his place on the left side of Jon.

Jon asked about Gendry’s day and joked about them going hunting the following morning. Lady Sansa smiled at that. They all knew he was rubbish at it, his feet hit the ground with too much force, and it had been decided he would stay on his horse for the duration of the hunt when he alone, had managed to scare two boars and a stag one morning. Gendry never minded the teasing, it made Jon smile, and Jon had seldom smiled in a long time.

Arya walked in late as she always did. Any other day she would have entered the hall with Gendry following suit, but not that day. ’Because you are stubborn and she has gone mad’ Gendry told himself as he looked down and ate his stew. Halfway through the meal, however, Davos seemed to decide he had had enough.

“What are you doing?” he whispered.

“Eating.” Gendry answered with the false confusion that Davos saw right through.

“What did you do, then? To the little lady, what did you do?”

“Nothing.”

“You did something.”

“Why’d you say that?”

“Because the little lady is staring at you and grabbing the hilt of her sword, and we both know she is more than capable of murder.”

“ Arya would never murder me” Gendry snorted. “It’s not my fault she’s gone mad.”

“So, you did something.”

“I did nothing.” He looked up to catch Arya looking straight at him, he smiled and got a grimace in return. “See,” he told Davos “I did nothing.”

“Then, why does she keep staring like that?”

“Because she’s gone mental.” Gendry said stabbing a carrot that was just a tad too raw with excessive force. To his utter embarrassment, the traitorous vegetable slipped from his plate and flew directly to the Lady Sansa’s wine-filled cup, making the Dornish red spill on her face. Gendry froze, the apologies he was going to blabber died in his throat, Arya’s hand instinctively gripped her brand new sword, and Jon … Jon started laughing. A roaring laughter none of them had heard in moons. The lady Sansa giggled and Arya took her hand from the sword he had given her earlier that day.

After supper, Jon walked with Gendry in the castle grounds as they had done every night since the war had ended. The silence that so complimented each other had become the paving stone in their friendship once Jon had forgiven him for lying about Arya, although the King had never been angry at the blacksmith.

“My sister is cross with you.” He said.

“Yes.”

“Why?”

“Because she knows you want to marry her to a Lord.”

“Did you not tell her that you are the Lord I’d wish she’d choose to marry?” Jon said his confusion in his eyes.

“Yes, I did.”

“Then?”

“I gave her a sword. Spent over a moon making it perfect, I even asked her on the Godswood.” Gendry said frustrated.

“The one she had with her? I take it she said yes, then? Why is she angry then?”

“Said she wanted a ring” Gendry said after huffing.

“A ring? Arya?”

Gendry shrugged his shoulders and kept walking, she’d gone insane. He had thought about a ring at first when Jon had given him his blessing but decided she would have thrown it in his face. Yet, she had taken offense at not getting one.

“Let her be mate,” Jon told him. “Sansa says she’s been moody for some time. Laughing one minute, and crying the next. She screamed at the servants the other day because they couldn’t give her raspberries after she had been vomiting all morning. Raspberries! This time of year, and this far North!”

‘Yes, my poor future wife has gone mental’ Gendry decided.

Gendry shrugged his shoulders and kept walking, she’d gone insane. He had thought about a ring at first when Jon had given him his blessing but decided she would have thrown it in his face. Yet, she had taken offense at not getting one.

“Let her be mate,” Jon told him. “Sansa says she’s been moody for some time. Laughing one minute, and crying the next. She screamed at the servants the other day because they couldn’t give her raspberries after she had been vomiting all morning. Raspberries! This time of year, and this far North!”

‘Yes, my poor future wife has gone mental’ Gendry decided.

Eye Contact

Gendry was early for supper that day, he stood near one of the tall walls in the Winterfell hall waiting for the rest to arrive. His fingers kept tugging his shirt down and the little sounds his boots made kept betraying he was fidgeting, despite having lunched and dinned with the Royals for weeks. He approached the table when Davos, Jon and Lady Sansa walked through the doors, and silently sat down beside the elder of the group when he took his place on the left side of Jon.

Jon asked about Gendry’s day and joked about them going hunting the following morning. Lady Sansa smiled at that. They all knew he was rubbish at it, his feet hit the ground with too much force, and it had been decided he would stay on his horse for the duration of the hunt when he alone, had managed to scare two boars and a stag one morning. Gendry never minded the teasing, it made Jon smile, and Jon had seldom smiled in a long time.

Arya walked in late as she always did. Any other day she would have entered the hall with Gendry following suit, but not that day. ’Because you are stubborn and she has gone mad’ Gendry told himself as he looked down and ate his stew. Halfway through the meal, however, Davos seemed to decide he had had enough.

“What are you doing?” he whispered.

“Eating.” Gendry answered with the false confusion that Davos saw right through.

“What did you do, then? To the little lady, what did you do?”

“Nothing.”

“You did something.”

“Why’d you say that?”

“Because the little lady is staring at you and grabbing the hilt of her sword, and we both know she is more than capable of murder.”

“ Arya would never murder me” Gendry snorted. “It’s not my fault she’s gone mad.”

“So, you did something.”

“I did nothing.” He looked up to catch Arya looking straight at him, he smiled and got a grimace in return. “See,” he told Davos “I did nothing.”

“Then, why does she keep staring like that?”

“Because she’s gone mental.” Gendry said stabbing a carrot that was just a tad too raw with excessive force. To his utter embarrassment, the traitorous vegetable slipped from his plate and flew directly to the Lady Sansa’s wine-filled cup, making the Dornish red spill on her face. Gendry froze, the apologies he was going to blabber died in his throat, Arya’s hand instinctively gripped her brand new sword, and Jon … Jon started laughing. A roaring laughter none of them had heard in moons. The lady Sansa giggled and Arya took her hand from the sword he had given her earlier that day.

After supper, Jon walked with Gendry in the castle grounds as they had done every night since the war had ended. The silence that so complimented each other had become the paving stone in their friendship once Jon had forgiven him for lying about Arya, although the King had never been angry at the blacksmith.

“My sister is cross with you.” He said.

“Yes.”

“Why?”

“Because she knows you want to marry her to a Lord.”

“Did you not tell her that you are the Lord I’d wish she’d choose to marry?” Jon said his confusion in his eyes.

“Yes, I did.”

“Then?”

“I gave her a sword. Spent over a moon making it perfect, I even asked her on the Godswood.” Gendry said frustrated.

“The one she had with her? I take it she said yes, then? Why is she angry then?”

“Said she wanted a ring” Gendry said after huffing.

“A ring? Arya?”

Gendry shrugged his shoulders and kept walking, she’d gone insane. He had thought about a ring at first when Jon had given him his blessing but decided she would have thrown it in his face. Yet, she had taken offense at not getting one.

“Let her be mate,” Jon told him. “Sansa says she’s been moody for some time. Laughing one minute, and crying the next. She screamed at the servants the other day because they couldn’t give her raspberries after she had been vomiting all morning. Raspberries! This time of year, and this far North!”

‘Yes, my poor future wife has gone mental’ Gendry decided.

body:
Arya x Gendry Week; Day 2: Caught Red-Handed

A continuation of yesterday!


“She was so hot, dude, dude!” Lommy would not shut up. Gendry supposed he did not know what to expect but still it was annoying as all get out. Gendry was barely paying him any mind, watching the girl that had attracted all of their attentions (the whole room really, it wasn’t just their trio), with her spontaneous shout. Somehow it was louder than Lommy and Hot Pie’s bickering over how they’d tell the story of the scar that was forming on his forehead. There was bears in some version, but none of it was true. Gendry was certain they just didn’t want to get him in trouble for assaulting someone, which technically he’d done. Only because they were threatening these two fucking morons.

Gendry was tough, the bruises that would form on his chest by the morning hardly bothered him, but the pulsing wound on his forehead, that really really hurt. Before he’d been trying his best to distract himself from it. Now, he was merely interested in her eyes. Gray, like an approaching storm, silver like the steel of a machine. Oh but she was hardly a machine. No, that would be stupid. She had a pulse, unlike most of his company. Aside from these two.

“She’s leaving,” Hot Pie whispered across Lommy’s lap into Gendry’s ear. He furrowed his eyebrows and glanced to his smaller, rotund friend.

“She’s already gone,” He said. She’d been gone for several minutes. The girl. What had the clerk announced when she left? Arry? Rya? Something… like that.

“Not her her! The other clerk! She’s gone! Now’s our chance!” Hot Pie said, before practically leaping to his feet and scurrying across the room, vaguely sneaky. It wasn’t, but it looked like what Hot Pie thought sneaky was. Lommy was already joining Hot Pie when Gendry called for them to stop. Whisper called.

“What are you doing!” No response, just more “sneaking”. He followed, lumbering to his feet, the blood pounding in his forehead. He really needed to lie down. They slipped around the counter, and when Gendry met them, Hot Pie was slowly opening the door. “What are you doing!” Gendry repeated. They looked at him. Clearly they had discussed this while he had been obsessing over her eyes. This is what he got for not listening to him.

“We’re finding out her name and shit from the papers. Obviously.” Lommy answered, and just like that they were inside the door. Gendry swore under his breath and looked around, whirling his head back and forth to try and catch sight of anyone around, like you know, hospital employees. Nothing. He swore again, then followed in. Now on the opposite side of the counter from where they had been. A few of the other people waiting noticed, but they didn’t say anything.

“This is so creepy and stalkery!” Gendry protested, but they weren’t listening to him. They looked through all of the papers, rooting through binders quickly. He shook his head and began to look through them too, the ones right where the clerks had been standing.

A bell rung, the sound of the door opening, and a woman and a little girl walked in, the girl looking that special kind of miserable that only a very sick person can quite reach. Lommy and Hot Pie quickly ducked underneath the counter and hissed at him to pretend to be a clerk. He looked at them, miffed at their ability to get him into the worst fucking situations.

“EXCUSE ME,” The mother announced loudly, calling everyone’s attention. “My girl needs help. Now.” Gendry’s mind raced. What the fuck did clerks do. Hand paperwork out. He had to find that. He did, fortunately quickly, and looked up to the woman, putting it out on the counter.

“Just fill that out, I think.” Gendry said. Then he tried to smile like a helpful clerk. The woman was very confused, judging by the expression and gestured towards her forehead. Right. He was bleeding profusely. He moved his own hand up and winced as he touched it. “This? Nothing. Please, take a seat.” They did hesitantly. He also wasn’t in hospital scrubs. Gendry looked down to a tittering Lommy and Hot Pie, and swore at them. Then he looked back to the papers, and found it.

“Arya Stark,” He whispered, and suddenly knowing her name. That made it all okay. Every bit of it. He knew her name, Arya. Arya Stark. It was wonderful, he could sing it aloud like in West Side Story. A cough came from behind him, and he and his two friends all turned simultaneously. There a clerk was standing, tapping her foot, arms crossed.

“We were just going!” Hot Pie assured her, as they scrambled away. Arya Stark. With the gray eyes. Fuck he was not going to forget that for a long time.

summary: all i ask: chapter two — caught red-handed
title: all i ask: chapter two — caught red-handed
body:
Fandoms / Pairing: A Song Of Ice And Fire / Gendrya
Series: Gendrya Week (3/?)
Words: 9,105
Chapter(s): 2/7
Rating: Teen+
AO3 / / FF.net

Arya: My dad wants you to come over for dinner tonight. Don’t wear sweats. And don’t wear white.

Gendry: Okay. No sweats is obvious but why no white clothes?

Arya: Because you eat like an animal, and I’d rather you didn’t wear something where a potential stain would be obvious.

Gendry: Always thinking ten steps ahead. You do make a wonderful girlfriend.

She also tries not to think of that final text for too long.

She fails miserably.

Arya: My dad wants you to come over for dinner tonight. Don’t wear sweats. And don’t wear white.

Gendry: Okay. No sweats is obvious but why no white clothes?

Arya: Because you eat like an animal, and I’d rather you didn’t wear something where a potential stain would be obvious.

Gendry: Always thinking ten steps ahead. You do make a wonderful girlfriend.

She also tries not to think of that final text for too long.

She fails miserably.

summary: Six Sentence Sunday
title: Six Sentence Sunday
body:
I might as well start calling these “Six Sentence Monday”…

Then she was stopped by the expression on Gendry’s face. It was… for lack of a better word, she could only describe it as stupid. He was staring at the girl, who was gesturing with her hand towards the opposite direction of their camp. Gendry’s eyes were wide, his face flushed, and his mouth agape – he looked as if he had seen all his birthdays coming at once.

Arya had seen such expressions before, in faces of men and boys when they were staring at a beautiful girl, and for some reason, it made her angry. She threw another look at the girl – what was so special about her to make Gendry behave so stupidly?

summary: Arya x Gendry Week, Day 1: Eye Contact «this is my first time actually writing something like this so feedback is always...
body:
Arya x Gendry Week, Day 1: Eye Contact

«this is my first time actually writing something like this so feedback is always appreciated. Happy AxG week to everyone!!»

There were days when everything seemed to crash down on her again. A thousand memories rushed to her mind like a flood, not leaving a single crevice in her tormented head for peace or calmness.

“ Are you alright? You seem a little bit strange.”

She looked up from the ground she was staring at to see blue, blue eyes fixed on her grey ones.

“Yes, yes… I’m just a little bit tired”, Arya mumbled, looking away from his concerned stare.  " Preparing for this war is keeping me from actual sleep"
The wind blew cold through the trees as her words drifted away.

“You shouldn’t lie to me, you know?”, he replied as he crouched down to the ground she was sitting on. “It’s the memories again, isn’t it?

Arya stared at the leaves that were pilled around her. The only place that could soothe the aching thoughts that disturbed her mind was the woods around Winterfell. The silence and the light breeze combined with the wolves howls seemed to relax her unrelaxed mind.

“I’m fine you stubborn bull”, she said, trying to smirk her way out of the sympathy he wanted to give her. “How did you even find me?”

“When you are not in Winterfell, you are in the woods”, Gendry responded, finally sitting beside her on the dirty ground. “Do you want to talk about it?”

Arya considered talking, but she knew that she wouldn’t be able to control her feelings and that the conversation would end with her crying and probably mad at herself for letting her emotions get a hold of her.

“Can we just stay here?”, she finally answered, after contemplating in silence for a while. “I don’t like to talk about it”.

She looked him in the eyes, trying to make sense of everything that had happened in her life. His blue eyes stared back at her with fondness and respect, not only calming her but accepting her choice of admiring the stars instead of trying to make sense of the state of confusion that filled her head.

“Yes, we can just stay here”, he replied, smiling at her.

They looked at the stars next to each other, thanking the presence of one another but never saying a word.

Her thoughts drifted away as she acknowledged that maybe this was the peace she was searching for.

summary: When Gendry will arrive at Winterfell and ask for Arya I’d like to see a scene similar to Mulan’s ending. Both Bran and Sansa...
body: When Gendry will arrive at Winterfell and ask for Arya I’d like to see a scene similar to Mulan’s ending. Both Bran and Sansa will be  in awe that Arya managed to find such a handsome lad for herself and Sansa will ask him if we would like to stay for dinner. While Bran, who can see the past and has totally watched the romance between Gendry and Arya blossoming, will ask him if he would like to stay forever.

blog.name: silkygoldmilkweed
blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

summary: O I C
title: O I C
body:
Rewatching season seven, and I think I can see–from the producers’ standpoint–why they made the creative choice to do the horrible Arya-and-Sansa-fight-pointlessly-about-Littlefinger plotline:

If Sansa and Arya have a happy reunion where they catch up and immediately express appreciation for each other, it wouldn’t be long before they started telling missing-time backstories and comparing notes on the common figure in both their stories: Sandor Clegane.

I think the producers very much want to keep any affirmative information about Sansa-Sandor offscreen until season 8. Sandor-Arya has been affirmed as a meaningful relationship for both of them with five separate references in dialogue: Brienne-Sansa, Arya-Jaqen, Arya-Waif, Arya-Brienne, Sandor-Brienne.

But the only explicit mention of Sandor in Sansa’s storyline between season three and season seven was Littlefinger to Sansa. But if Sansa responded, she would be handing over precious information about herself to Littlefinger, the person in the world who least deserves it and is least trustworthy in re her personal life. (And then of course he manages to reinforce that she cannot trust to him by cluelessly asking what she needs to be happy. Sansa would never answer that question at this point; she understands finally how his duplicitous intelligence-gathering works.)

Anyway, they have to have Sansa and Arya’s conversations be sparse and fraught and focused externally (Littlefinger! the Lannisters!), or Arya tells Sansa that she was at the Red Wedding but she wasn’t killed because the Hound saved her, and Sansa tells Arya is true that the Hound saved her from being raped and furthermore offered to commit treason to free her from the Lannisters.

If Sansa and Arya have a Sandor talk in season seven, it gives away too much of the emotional throughline of season eight. So the writers cooked up this absurd Littlefinger caper to keep the girls “busy” between the Arya-Sansa reunion and the season-ending offing of Littlefinger.
